Reviews.Title: “Definitely not for the mobility challenged”
Reviews.Author: Ozziegiraffe
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to meet a friend for a weekend, because it was the cheapest available in the city and our budget was limited. I need to use a lift due to arthritis. The door was very heavy, and the lift did not arrive level with the outside. The twin room was adequate, although the power connections were antiquated and we were told that as we were leaving when the pub was closed on Sunday, we could stay until our transport was due to leave, which was good on a wet weekend. However, the shared bathroom was a hazard, with a high step into the shower, and no grab rail. After showering the first evening, I gave it a miss the second for safety reasons. Breakfast was help yourself, in a breakfast room, provided the night before. By the time we got down (about 8 am), all the milk was gone the first morning, probably taken by fellow guests, and as the pub downstairs was still closed, we coundn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “scared of being scared”
Reviews.Author: kazcity
Reviews.Content: oh dear, we are booked in to this motel or PUB for weekend in sydney, now i am really worried about what we have booked into. please someone give me confidence taht it will be ok sorry i cant put rating in, however after my experiance i will

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leigh H
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Australia with my boyfriend we paid a deposit to stay in the Grand Hotel and in the end we didn't even bother to stay! We arrived on a Sunday morning at 10am. The first issue was that it was on top of a pub - I didn't quite realise that it was literally on top of a bar! Stupid me, maybe. The whole place was shut up and we couldn't get in. Luckily a cleaner, (what he did clean in there I'm not really sure but I will come to that later), lent me his phone to ring upstairs on the number left at the door (upon arrival my mobile phone didn't work and I was stood there after travelling for like two days with all my gear). I got an answer which said that check in was technically at 12 but he would come down and let me in. Poor customer service I think! 5 minutes later (after 4 other people had also turned up) a hungover and obviously 'just got out of bed' Australian comes down and takes us up stairs. There is no reception to speak of and the whole place was pretty dirty, dull and dismal and had that odour of stale pub. We were shown our room and the separate toilet and shower was pointed out. These were just tiled rooms so no problems there to speak of after just looking. We were told that they didn't except card payment and to pay in cash so luckily I said that we would need to get to a cash machine and would pay on our return. The room smelt of sweat and I immediately opened a window as it needed a good airing. There were unwashed tea cups and the bin in the room was still full of rubbish. I dared not even look in the bed at the sheets! The electrics to the room were operated by a remote in which the batteries were sellotaped into - safe, I think not! We then went and checked into another hotel for not much more money which we feel was well spent as we probably would have spent it avoiding staying there anyway! I have stayed in nicer, cleaner and better equipped hostels! I am not normally a person to moan about the service somewhere and this is the first review I have ever written on here but I just wanted to make sure that other people weren't faced with also 'doing a runner' to not stay here! I hope this was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, underserviced, will not be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: crazybree
Reviews.Content: We booked a room that sleeps 4, including continental breakfasts for the next morning. When we arrived we were given a room that only slept 3 people. When we queried this, we were provided another room with a single bed in it for our 4th person - on a different floor. Acceptable, but annoying given that we all wanted to stay together. Then there was the key issue... They electronic key / tag didn't work & the staff were less than concerned with getting it fixed. In the end we went out & had to leave the door to our room unlocked so that we could get back in because the hotel would be closed when we returned & they would not be able to let us in. Hardly high security! Then there was the issue of our breakfast - neither the kitchen nor the hotel was open on the Sunday morning! So there was nowhere to 'claim' our continental breakfast that was 'included' in our booking, nor was there anyone to talk to about it!! We just had to let ourselves out & put our key in the deposit box. And for $150/night for 4 people, we could have gotten a room in a much nicer hotel & shared a king bed / single / couch & been much more comfortable, plus we would have had our own bathroom & hotel staff to actually address any issues! And I must not forget to mention that the sheets were stained. Who knows if they were actually washed since the last guests stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie1980
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, the location is excellent, and 2 mins walk from the Wynyard train station, very central. I booked a single room, which was 'upgraded' to a twin room. The first night of three, I slept in the bed near the window - bad choice, it was badly tilted to the left! The only real annoyance I had with the place was that I got back to my room around 2am on the last night I'd booked. What nobody told me, either at time of booking or on check in, was that the computer system makes the magnetic keys inoperable after midnight on the night before you check out, so of course my key didn't work. Luckily a late night attendant wasn't far away, but after a long night it was the last thing I needed. No major noise problems and the shared bathrooms were very clean. I wouldn't recommend using the lift though, I didn't trust it.

Reviews.Title: “Shud be shut down”
Reviews.Author: Bodsysmissus
Reviews.Content: I will write this as shortly as possible now to start off with rude service with staff to not shown where to go for room then realizing we are sharing bathroom an toilet which turn out ok due to one other person there that cleaned it. Now it prob wud of been good if they didn't rip us off (me and partner) I'n the room price we paid more then what was quoted and if the room had air con or atleast another fan due to not having this the room was soo hot and there is no fly screen on window so that's wasn't good aswell as we couldn't sleep due to the excessive noise every night. They beds were fine as it's was only for 3 nights they were made ok. As we read the reviews when we got there it was a shame also there is no free breakfast thy said no also when we left the place I'n morning there is no where to leave room key or any one to see u off. This would not be a good place for a fire aswell I'f ever happened we would not be able to get out of this place the oh&s standards are bot up to scratch the accomadation part should be shut down

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: pete2285
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic but represents excellent value for money. The place is quite old but in good condition and spotlessly clean! Bathrooms and bedrooms are very clean which can sometimes be a rare. Breakfast was self serve and adequate. Although in the city centre it was not too noisy and really well located to transport.

Reviews.Title: “Was very happy - I got what I expected - IT'S A PUB!”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel2350
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews before staying here I was a little worried. When I arrived though I found that it was what I expected (prior to reading reviews) a pub in a great location. What do people expect from a pub, you cannot compare its services with a hotel/motel. Our checkin was very good, remember that it is a pub though and they may have to serve a couple of beers before they can take you to your room (sit back relax and have a beer yourself while you wait). We were taken to our room with bathrooms, toilet and breakfast room all pointed out along the way. The room was simple but clean and quaint in an old pub sort of way. My husband and I had a romantic breakfast of cocoa pops and toast in the breakfast room as we sad back and listened to the quietness of the city in the morning. The Grand Hotel is in a reasonable quiet location, we had to keep saying to each other - I can't beleive we are in the centre of Sydney! The only thing that i would say wasn't good was the room full of ratbags next door who were partying most of the night.. luckily we were exhausted and slept through most of it! In saying this though - this is not the Grand Hotels fault.... remember it is a pub in the centre of Sydney. I think the Grand Hotel was awesome value for money and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel is a total dump”
Reviews.Author: cjaz
Reviews.Content: Paid $140 a night for the family room. No ensuite, shared bathroom which was filthy. no A/c black and white TV, checked out and moved into a better hotel. The backpackers was far better than this place. breaches the OHS Act in every way. One to avoid. Should be closed down. Third world accomodation

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Grand”
Reviews.Author: swazzle
Reviews.Content: Even with good quality silicon ear plugs, the air conditioner outside my room kept me awake most of the night(s) (2). The way the place shuts down on Sundays is really eerie. My room was not clean and the complimentary continental breakfast was never mentioned (there's no one there on Sundays, so don't see how any food could be provided...So don't count on it.)

Reviews.Title: “Affordable,Close to City,Tidy,Old world Charm”
Reviews.Author: Trueblue71Wollongong
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand hotel, Sydney with my family. We had tickets to a show, all we needed was overnight accommodation.We found the room to be large enough for my self, my husband and our two children ages 6yrs and 10yrs old. the room was clean and comfortable. There was a television and remote in the room, there was a clean bar fridge, and a kettle, cups and coffee making facilities, no milk though.We arrived after 10pm after the show. the bar down stairs had a few patrons, not rowdy or anything like that, rather pleasant actually. We ate our dinner we had purchased outside, in our room. We then went to sleep. There was a slight amount of noise from outside in the street, traffic etc, but I was able to fall asleep in a reasonable amount of time. My children slept okay also. My husband is a fairly light sleeper, so he didn't sleep too well.There is no parking at the hotel, so we parked our car in a near by street. There was no parking fees after 10pm in the street, we had to move the car by 7am though. We moved the car to a nearby parking station, in the early bird section of the car park, we had to stay until 4pm to get the cheap fee of $24 for the day. We went back to the Grand Hotel and had some breakfast in the 'Breakfast Room'. We found the dining area to be neat and tidy. There was a complimentary continental breakfast included in the cost of our room. the breakfast on offer was ample for us, we had cereal,toast, spreads,fruit, juice and coffee. The only things that I would perhaps gripe about was the lift was a bit ancient, but okay, it works!! There is the option of the stairs of course.There was a slight smell overall in the hotel but nothing offensive, just old I guess.The shower hot/cold was hard to regulate, but I guess that is just everyone else using the showers at the same time, so quickly in and quickly out....no big deal! The best part was that the hotel is very close to the city, you can walk to the bridge, the rocks, circular quay etc without any troubles at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great central Sydney value accomodation”
Reviews.Author: andy4wfc
Reviews.Content: The Grand has an amazing location and everything you need for a fun stay in Sydney CBD. The staff are friendly and the manager Dan makes you extremely welcome in the sports bar on the ground floor. Great for a weekend stay in the city, or longer to explore everything Sydney has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised!!”
Reviews.Author: Bigmaggot
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we didn't listen to the previous reviewers, I saw some lovely rooms when booking direct on their website, I even checked with the reception that rooms had been recently refurbished. Unfortunately when seeing our room I was very disappointed, from what I could see it was refurbished in the 80's and our door didn't even lock but didn't find out until the night before we were leaving. Breakfast was included, but really don't recommend with horrible cereals, milk, bread, OJ etc. Where do they buy these from... Only plus side was the location, 5 minute walk from darling harbour and circular quay, oh and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JATZGlasgow
Reviews.Content: WE stayed here and found it to be very unfriendly towards families, we had our grandaughter with us and she was under 18 (she was 16) and wasnt even allowed into the place to have dinner , we were told we would have to eat elsewhere or buy her a meal and she would have to stay in her room to eat it and we could have ours in the room with her, we found this un acceptable as there was no where in the room to eat a meal unless you sat on the bed. When we arrived were told by the barmaid or who ever she was that my grandaughter had to wait outside in the street while we checked in as reception was in the bar and she could come in , as we had already paid for the room had we known before that family was not welcome we would NOT have stayed there. The room was a FAMILY room which i cannot understand why they have them , what do they class as a family if under 18's are not welcome in there. The lift was heavy and hard to hold the doors open , not very disabled friendly , the room had tea/ coffee milk but no kettle, the pillows were flat as pancakes and the bathroom which is shared with other guests had a bath and shower, the shower had no hot water running to it and was cold so tried to have a hot bath instead to find there was no bath plug, no toilet paper in the shared toilet either, I woke the next morning after finally getting to sleep around 12am , very noisy from the street level below to find my legs had broken out with some sort of rash and bites on them just hope it was not bedbugs . I found the staff to be very rude if i asked sort some sort of help , it was like to much bother for them . I would never stay there again or reccommend it to anyone who plans on staying in sydney with a family .

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Acceptable--You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: RedScarf106
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Grand Hotel at 8:30am after our flight from the US. I don't understand how the other reviewers could have found the place empty--there were two people working behind the bar and about ten customers watching football matches, even at that early hour. Our check in was smooth, and we were shown our room. It was perfectly acceptable--it had a small fridge, a small TV (no remote, unfortunately), a sink, and a pole for hanging clothes. The bath and toilet were adequately clean, although the shower curtain was mildewy. But for $95AU (that would be about $65 USD at the current exchange rate) the location CANNOT be beat. The hotel is near everything a tourist could want. When we travel, we usually don't like to spend much time sitting around the room, so if all you need is a place to sleep, I would highly recommend this hotel. The bar downstairs was popular for happy hour, and the included continental breakfast was fine--other hotels that we stayed at in Australia that were double the price didn't include breakfast, so give the Grand some credit there. Again, if you're paying so little for such a great location, you have to expect that it's not going to be the Sofitel. But for basic service, we were more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand is a terribly misleading name”
Reviews.Author: BunnyTravel
Reviews.Content: I really wouldn't recommend this place. We Arrived at 10am-ish on a rainy day only to find, like another traveller posted, no-one there. We also called the number on the door and had trouble getting through. We were able to push open the front door, which I think was supposed to be locked, but we were greatful as it gave us somewhere to get out of the rain. We eventually contacted someone on our mobile phone, but the next part of the story is a comedy of misunderstandings that wound up with us wasting a few good hours of our short sydney stay and eventually going down the road and booking a new hotel for the night. What we saw of the hotel was very dirty and dingy, the banisters on the stairs were sticky to the touch. I didn't encounter the smell others complained of though. I can say however that the location of the grand is incredible, and if you're looking for central accomodation for cheap this is a reasonable deal, but after the dodgy reception and the general state of the place, I wouldn't reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An old hotel that sufficed but I had a run-in with the manager on duty”
Reviews.Author: keepin_em_honest
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Grand with my boyfriend and found it to be quite ok except for a complaint he had with damp (gave him a chest cough) and the smell but I found it bearable. He didn't like the room at first (aesthetically) but got used to it. From our room, we could hear music down below one night but it didn't last long and was ok. Room size is standard, not big but not cramped either. It is near Circular Quay and is reasonably priced. It includes a continental breakfast which we found to be sufficient (a selection of cereals, breads and juices, tea/coffee, fruit). The room has some old furniture but this keeps with the style of the old building (furnished with large wardrobe, double mattress, side tables, lamps, drapes). The TV plug had to be awkwardly positioned to receive reception but worked fine. There is a fridge (a bit of mould but just needed a wipe) and a fanlight, both with remote. There's also tea/coffee making facilities, box of tissues, clock radio, a radiator and even a sink, which is useful for brushing teeth, washing cups & cutlery etc. There are about 7 rooms to at least 2 bathrooms (separate showers) / separate toilets which are close by. I liked the bathroom more than the room, they're quite nice. Also clean. There is also an ironing board in the hall. The hall was kind of dingy. I think it's better value overall than the Sydney Central YHA (for example) as although the YHA is newer with an ensuite, it's pretty much a bare room (no TV, fridge etc) from what I know (haven't stayed there). If you can stand the fact that some of the furniture in The Grand is old and there's a slight smell (though not that unpleasant), then the choice is yours. It's got cheaper weekly rates than the hostel as well. Only thing is it's not equipped with a self-catering kitchen. It depends on what your needs are (we stayed in the room alot of the time ;-)). I'm not dissing the YHA, I'm sure other people would still prefer them (I think one of the best things about any hostel are the self-catering kitchens). Reception is in the small pub downstairs. The lift is pretty heavy going (pushing the doors open). I've stayed here twice (was cheapest I could find in Sydney for the price/facilities/willingness to pay). Both times I booked through the manager, a nice englishman named Dan, whom I found to be friendly and helpful (he remembered me from the first time). I worked out a discounted price with him for my second booking but when I arrived, I was met by another manager (female) on shift at the time who quoted me a price of over $800.00, worked out on the daily rate (even though they have weekly rates and I was staying for almost 2 weeks). I explained the price agreed to with Dan but she said she is the manager on duty now (so it didn't matter) and seemed insistant that I pay the price she quoted. I refused and asked her to call Dan but she said he's in a meeting then apparently tried to call him but couldn't get through. Before all this, I found her quite professional and knew everything to say but my opinion started to drop dramatically when I asked if she could mind my bags so I could use the toilet. In a demanding tone with a facial expression to match, she scornfully uttered the word "please" (meaning I should say please, even though there was NOTHING wrong in how I asked her, just because I had not said please). I was taken aback by her rudeness but obliged without a word and even managed a smile. When I asked her to repeat something else, she replied I'd be able to hear her if I took off my headphones. I said I can hear her ok with them on (music was off). I thought the tone of that sentence and her voice was sarcastic and simply inappropriate. Consequently, I became agitated and upset by the time we reached the dispute over the price. I bore her attitude prior to that. She thought the price Dan gave me was generously low. I suppose it is when you balance that against the inflated price she tried to fleece from me, considering that (on her stance) she should have worked out the price based on the weekly rate, not the daily rate which is unfair. The whole point of a weekly rate is that it acts as an enticement/reward for someone to stay extra nights. I put this to her. She checked the price list and agreed there is a weekly rate (but I assumed she would have known as she's the manager and because it's basic information!). I referred to her earlier words to me but she replied she says "please" to everyone. I blurted out I that I don't care and that I'm not a child. It later appeared she was apologetic as conveyed by her actions (eg helpfully escorting us up to our room) or perhaps she was rattled by my earlier reaction, as she seemed nervous. Or maybe also an attempt to dissuade me from taking it further? In the end, I paid the price I had agreed on but not without the hassle. The fact is, she has no right to speak to a PAYING GUEST in that manner. What she does in her own time is her business but in the workplace, especially of a customer service-oriented industry, it was a display of unprofessionalism. I wished I remained calm in the situation but on the other hand, I should not have felt pushed to react that way. It was a dampener to my stay. Overall, the room itself might not be perfect but it wasn't the pits either (I've seen bad).

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Danhdz
Reviews.Content: We chose this place based on a Lonelyplant recommendation which could not have been off by much more. We stayed there for three nights and spent the first night in the family room. This is a corner room which was loud, and we switched to a smaller room which was small but quieter. I have really nothing good to say about this place other than that it is well located - the rooms are loud, dirty (full of dust), the bathroom was separate and full of mould, and you deal with the pub staff who, while not unfriendly, are not really hotel staff. Breakfast is disappointing. Overall, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great hotel but good value and amazing location”
Reviews.Author: LondonMary
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel I was more than disappointed. The room was clean but smelt and it was quite dingey. However when I stopped to think that we were a stones throw away from Circular Quay and had only paid Â£40 per night over the new year period I realised that the value and the location were more important than the room - after all it was only a base to sleep in. I would recommend the hotel on the value and the location and if you're prepared to forfeit an ensuite and creature comforts then you should stay here if not I would recommend going else where!

Reviews.Title: “Er No!”
Reviews.Author: fionapyle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Grand Hotel after travelling for 24 hours, we arrived at 8.30 am to find the hotel closed! No sign of anyone!!! We phoned the telephone number that was on a poster stuck in the window of the hotel, to be hung up on two or three times. I found an emergancy telephone number on my Lastminute booking confirmation and called that, after an hour a young aussie girl came down to help us, she left us waiting outside for a further hour. By which time I was livid. If I hadn't already paid Lastminute the full amount of our stay I would have walked away and found somewhere else to stay. When we eventually got in the hotel, the lift was broke so we lugged our suitcases up what felt like a hundred flights of stairs. When we got to our room, it was clean, but really small, no air con and we had to share a bathroom which could not have been further away from our room on our floor. Breakfast was included, so my husband and I ventured down to get some. We were greeted by a few ceral boxes, some bread and a toaster in a room, we poured our ceral and then added the milk, only to find the milk was off! My husband was nearly sick! Poor thing! We only stayed two nights, thank goodness! In this time I only ever saw one other guest and the only member off staff we saw was the grumpy girl who let us in. It was really noisey from the road outside, we hardly slept at all. I was really dissapointed in this hotel, normally Lastminute come up trumps with the hotels, this time it was awful.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 30 Hunter Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
